error.code: The DFS Replication service is restarting frequently.
error.description: The DFS Replication service has restarted times in the past 7 days. This problem can affect the replication of all replicated folders to and from this server.
error.action: If you restarted the service manually, you can safely ignore this message. For information about troubleshooting frequent service restart issues, see .

error.code: The DFS Replication service has stopped because of an internal error.
error.description: The DFS Replication service has stopped because of an internal error from which it cannot recover. No content is replicating to or from this server. Error in line . The service will be restarted automatically by the service control manager.
error.action: If the service fails to restart or if you are seeing this often, you will need to investigate the issue. For more information about troubleshooting this problem, see .

error.code: The DFS Replication service failed to restart after a backup or restore operation.
error.description: The DFS Replication service failed to restart after a backup or restore operation. This failure can occur because the service encountered an internal error. The DFS Replication service must be restarted manually.
error.action: Restart the DFS Replication service either by using the Services snap-in or by typing net start dfsr at the command prompt. For more information about troubleshooting this problem, see .

error.code: The DFS Replication service failed to process the list of restored volumes.
error.description: The DFS Replication service failed to process the list of restored volumes. This failure can occur if the service encountered errors while accessing the list.
error.action: The service will retry processing the list in minutes.

error.code: Read-only replicated folders cannot be restored authoritatively.
error.description: The DFS Replication service failed a restore request. This could happen if an attempt was made to restore the contents of a read-only replicated folder authoritatively. Read-only replicated folders should only be restored non-authoritatively. Authoritative restores should be performed only on read-write replicated folders. Additional Information: Replicated Folder ID: ; Replicated Folder Name: .

error.code: Domain controller is unreachable.
error.description: The DFS Replication service could not contact domain controller to access configuration objects. Replication is currently stopped. The service will attempt to replicate again during the next poll cycle, in minutes. Possible causes of this event include: TCP/IP connectivity, firewall, Active Directory Domain Services, or DNS issues.
error.action: For information about troubleshooting this problem, see .

error.code: Unable to start a RPC listener.
error.description: The DFS Replication service was unable to start an RPC listener. Replication is currently stopped on this server. This error can be caused by RPC issues, port filtering or a firewall blocking the dynamic end-point mapper. DFS Replication encountered an issue on port with error ID: ().
error.action: For information about troubleshooting RPC issues see .

error.code: Unable to write debug logs.
error.description: The DFS Replication service cannot write to the debug logs in . The volume might be out of disk space, or the DFS Replication service might not have sufficient security permissions to modify the debug log files.
error.action: See additional information about disk space under the informational section in the "Amount of disk space used by replicated folders" table. For information about troubleshooting this problem, see .

error.code: The DFS Replication service debug logging is disabled.
error.description: The DFS Replication service encountered errors while configuring the debug log files. Logging is disabled until this error is resolved. Debug log path is and error ID: ().
error.action: For more information about troubleshooting this problem, see .

error.code: Volume is full or failing.
error.description: The DFS Replication service stopped replication on volume . This failure can occur because the disk is full, the disk is failing, or a quota limit has been reached.
error.action: Increase the available disk space on the specified volume or move the replicated folder to a different volume. See additional information about disk space under the informational section in the "Amount of disk space used by replicated folders" table.

error.code: A database problem is blocking replication on volume .
error.description: The DFS Replication service was unable to recover from an internal database error on volume . Replication has stopped for all replicated folders on this volume until the database is automatically rebuilt. If the database is rebuilt successfully, replication will resume after the rebuilding is complete. If the database cannot be rebuilt, a separate event is generated. If you are seeing this error more than two times in seven days, we recommend that you run Chkdsk on the volume that contains the database.
error.action: For information about troubleshooting this problem, see .

error.code: DFS Replication has experienced an update sequence number (USN) journal wrap on .
error.description: A USN journal wrap occurred times in the past 7 days on . DFS Replication monitors the USN journal to detect changes made to the replicated folder. A USN journal wrap occurs when large numbers of files change so quickly that the USN journal must discard the oldest changes (before DFS Replication has had a chance to detect the changes) to stay within the specified size limit of the USN journal. Although DFS Replication automatically recovers from this problem, replication stops temporarily for replicated folders stored on this volume. Repeated journal wraps usually indicate that the USN journal is too small.
error.action: Increase the size of the USN journal. For more information, see the .

error.code: DFS Replication has experienced an update sequence number (USN) journal loss on .
error.description: A USN journal loss occurred times in the past 7 days on . DFS Replication monitors the USN journal to detect changes made to the replicated folder. Although DFS Replication automatically recovers from this problem, replication stops temporarily for replicated folders stored on this volume. Repeated journal loss usually indicates disk issues.
error.action: For more information about troubleshooting this problem, see .

error.code: DFS Replication failed to recover from USN journal wrap or USN journal loss on volume .
error.description: DFS Replication will attempt to recover from this problem automatically on volume , but replication will not take place until USN journal recovery is complete. This failure has occurred times in the past 7 days on this volume.
error.action: For more information, see .

error.code: The DFS Replication service failed to create an USN journal on volume .
error.description: The DFS Replication service failed to create an NTFS change journal on volume . Replication is disabled for all replicated folders on this volume. The volume must have at least MB free. Error ID: ().
error.action: Ensure you have sufficient disk space. For more information about troubleshooting this problem, see .

error.code: DFS Replication service stopped replication on replicated folder .
error.description: The DFS Replication service stopped replication on replicated folder at local path due to Error ID: ().
error.action: For information about troubleshooting this problem, see .

error.code: One or more replicated folders are not replicating to this member because their memberships are disabled.
error.description: The replicated folders listed above are not participating in replication because their memberships were manually disabled on this member.
error.action: If you want these replicated folders to participate in replication, enable the desired memberships using the DFS Management snap-in or the Dfsradmin.exe command-line tool.

error.code: Premature purging of staging files is impacting performance on replicated folder .
error.description: Staging files are being purged prematurely because the staging quota for replicated folder is too small. This purging can cause excessive disk I/O and CPU usage. To avoid this problem, increase the quota of the staging folder. This has occurred times in the past 72 hours.
error.action: Increase the size of the staging folder. To see best practices for staging folder sizing, see .

error.code: DFS Replication failed to clean up old staging files for replicated folder .
error.description: DFS Replication failed to clean up old staging files. As a result, some large files might fail to replicate, and the replicated folder might become out of sync. The service will automatically try to clean up the staging folder again. This failure has happened times in the past 7 days.
error.action: For more information, see .

error.code: Staging folder for replicated folder has exceeded its configured size.
error.description: The DFS Replication service detected that the staging space usage has exceeded its quota size ( MB) for the replicated folder at local path . The service is currently using MB of staging space. The service might fail to replicate some large files and the replicated folder might become out-of-sync. The service is trying to clean up staging space automatically. This has occurred times in the past 72 hours.
error.action: To resolve this problem, increase the configured size of the staging folder. To see best practices for staging folder sizing, see .

error.code: Staging folder cannot be accessed.
error.description: DFS Replication cannot replicate files in the replicated folders listed above because the staging folder at cannot be opened. Replication can not take place because the service is unable to create staging files.
error.action: Verify that the staging folder path exists and that the service has access to it.

error.code: One or more replicated folders have sharing violations.
error.description: Due to ongoing sharing violations, DFS Replication cannot replicate files in the replicated folders listed above. This problem is affecting files in replicated folders.
error.action: Verify that the files you want to replicate are closed and have no open handles to them. For information about troubleshooting sharing violations, see .

error.code: One or more replicated folders have sharing violations.
error.description: Due to ongoing sharing violations, DFS Replication cannot replicate files in the replicated folders listed above. This problem is affecting files in replicated folders.
error.action: Verify that the files you want to replicate are closed and have no open handles to them. For information about troubleshooting sharing violations, see the .

error.code: Sharing violations are preventing replication of a folder in replicated folder .
error.description: The DFS Replication service has been repeatedly prevented from getting folder information due to consistent sharing violations encountered on a folder. The service is unable to replicate the folder and files in that folder until the sharing violation is resolved.
error.action: Verify that the files you want to replicate are closed and have no open handles to them. For information about troubleshooting sharing violations, see the .

error.code: Initial replication for replicated folder is blocked due to sharing violations.
error.description: The DFS Replication service has been repeatedly prevented from moving file to the Pre-existing folder due to consistent sharing violations encountered on the file. Initial sync will not be completed until this problem is resolved and local changes will not replicate out.
error.action: Verify that the files you want to replicate are closed and have no open handles to them. For information about troubleshooting sharing violations, see the .

error.code: Replication of files encrypted by EFS is not supported by the DFS Replication service.
error.description: The DFS Replication service encountered a file encrypted using the Encrypting File System (EFS) in replicated folder with local path . The file will not be replicated because the replication of files encrypted by EFS is not supported by the DFS Replication service.
error.action: Replication of files encrypted by EFS is not supported by the DFS Replication service.

error.code: Replication of this type of reparse point is not supported by the DFS Replication service.
error.description: The DFS Replication service encountered an unsupported reparse point in replicated folder with local path . This reparse point () will not be replicated because the replication of this type of reparse point is not supported by the DFS Replication service.
error.action: Replication of this type of reparse point is not supported by the DFS Replication service.

error.code: DFS Replication unable to replicate files for replicated folder due to insufficent disk space.
error.description: The DFS Replication service was unable to replicate one or more files because adequate free space to replicate the files was not available for staging folder .
error.action: Determine whether the volume reported hosts the replicated folder, the staging folder or both as in default configuration. See additional information about disk space under the informational section in the table titled "Current used and free disk space on volumes where replicated folders are stored". Ensure that enough free space is available on the volume for replication to proceed or move the associated replicated folder or staging folder to a different volume that has more free space.

error.code: Communication errors are preventing replication with .
error.description: DFS Replication cannot replicate with partner due to a communication error. The DFS Replication service used partner DNS name , IP address , and WINS address but failed with error ID: ().
error.action: Check for network connectivity problems, for troubleshooting RPC issues see and for additional troubleshooting information, see .

error.code: Communication errors are preventing replication with partner .
error.description: DFS Replication cannot replicate with partner due to a communication error. This error can occur if the host is unreachable, or if the DFS Replication service is not running on the server. The DFS Replication service used partner DNS name , IP address , and WINS address but failed with error ID: ().
error.action: Check for network connectivity and service related problems. For troubleshooting RPC issues see and for additional troubleshooting information, see .

error.code: Communication errors are preventing replication with partner .
error.description: DFS Replication cannot replicate with partner for replication group . The partner did not recognize the connection or the replication group configuration. The DFS Replication service used partner DNS name , IP address , and WINS address but failed with error ID: ().
error.action: This error can occur when the partner does not have the latest DFS Replication configuration information. The service will retry the connection periodically. For troubleshooting information, , see .

error.code: Communication with partner failed due to incompatible versions of the service.
error.description: The DFS Replication service failed to communicate with partner . The version of the communication protocol is different on the partner. This server has ., while partner has .. No data is being replicated to or from this partner.
error.action: Ensure that the same version of the DFS Replication service is installed on both machines, including any service packs, downloads and hotfixes.

error.code: Inconsistent configuration detected (invalid object).
error.description: The DFS Replication service detected invalid object data while polling for configuration information. Additional information includes Object DN: Attribute Name: and domain controller: .
error.action: For information about troubleshooting this problem, see .

error.code: Inconsistent configuration detected (conflict).
error.description: The DFS Replication service detected a conflict between two or more objects while polling Active Directory Domain Services for configuration information. The conflict detected on was resolved by using .
error.action: You can use the command-line tool Dfsradmin.exe to resolve this issue. For information about troubleshooting this error, see .

error.code: Inconsistent configuration detected (missing object).
error.description: The DFS Replication service detected an inconsistent object while polling domain controller for configuration information. The object at references another object at that does not exist.
error.action: The service will try polling again in minutes. If the problem continues, .

error.code: Bad configuration parameter.
error.description: The DFS Replication service detected a bad parameter in configuration. The parameter of is . The service cannot recover from this error and will disable the in question until the parameter is fixed.
error.action: For information about troubleshooting this problem, see .

error.code: Bad configuration parameter.
error.description: The DFS Replication service detected a bad parameter in configuration. The parameter is . The service has ignored the input value and used the default [] instead.
error.action: For more information about troubleshooting this problem, see .

error.code: The DFS Replication service detected that required Active Directory Domain Services schema objects are not available.
error.description: The DFS Replication service detected that required Active Directory Domain Services schema objects are not available on domain controller . DFS Replication expected but found . This problem can occur if the schema was not upgraded, the schema partition has not yet replicated to domain controller , or if the version of the schema is incompatible. The service will try again in the next Active Directory Domain Services poll cycle
error.action: Please make sure the required schema upgrade has been applied to the Forest and that Active Directory Domain Services replication of the Schema partition was able to reach this Domain Controller. For more information, see .

error.code: The DFS Replication service failed to update configuration in Active Directory Domain Services.
error.description: The DFS Replication service failed to update configuration in Active Directory Domain Services. This operation will be retried in the next polling cycle. The service attempted to connect to domain controller and failed with error ID: (). Additional information includes object category: and object DN: . Replication may be disabled until this error is fixed.
error.action: The service will retry this operation periodically. For more information about troubleshooting this problem, see .

error.code: A read-write replicated folder is configured with only one way connections.
error.description: The replication group contains a read-write replicated folder. The DFS Replication service has detected that there is no outbound connection between this server and any of its replication partners. Setting up a read-write replicated folder with only a one-way connection to a replication partner is not a supported configuration. Please create the missing outbound connection to this server using the DFS Management console in order to fix this broken replication topology. Additional Information: Replication Group ID: ; Member ID: .
error.action: Please create the missing outbound connection to this server using the DFS Management console in order to fix this broken replication topology.

error.code: A read-only replicated folder is configured with no inbound connections.
error.description: The replication group contains a read-only replicated folder. The DFS Replication service has detected that there is no inbound connection to this server from any of its replication partners. An inbound connection from a member hosting a read-write copy of this replicated folder is required so that the DFS Replication service can keep the contents of the read-only replicated folder up to date. Please create the missing inbound connection to this server using the DFS Management console in order to fix this broken replication topology. Additional Information: Replication Group ID: ; Member ID: .
error.action: Please create the missing inbound connection to this server using the DFS Management console in order to fix this broken replication topology.

error.code: Registration failed for the DFS Replication service providers.
error.description: The DFS Replication service failed to register the Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) providers with error ID: (). The DFS Replication service requires a WMI provider on each member of the replication group. This provider is used to collect diagnostics and operational information. If the provider cannot be registered, this information cannot be collected and replication is disabled for all replicated folders on this server.
error.action: For information about troubleshooting this problem, see and to resolve the error string.

error.code: Volume is not supported for DFS Replication.
error.description: The DFS Replication service is unable to start replication on volume because the volume is not supported.
error.action: Ensure that the volume is a local, non-removable volume formatted using the NTFS file system.

error.code: Replicated folder overlaps with an FRS replica set.
error.description: The DFS Replication service cannot replicate the replicated folder at local path because it overlaps with a folder that is replicated using File Replication service (FRS). This configuration is unsupported.
error.action: Fix this problem by not overlapping this replicated folder with an FRS replica set. That is, do not replicate the same local path using DFS Replication and FRS.

error.code: The replicated folder has an invalid local path.
error.description: DFS Replication cannot replicate the replicated folder because the local path is not the fully qualified path name of an existing, accessible local folder. This replicated folder is not replicating to or from this server.
error.action: Fix this problem by pointing the replicated folder to a valid local path using the DFS Management snap-in or the Dfsradmin.exe command-line tool.

error.code: Local path of replicated folder does not match the newly configured local path.
error.description: The DFS Replication service detected that the local path of a replicated folder in its database does not match the newly configured local path of the replicated folder . The service will replicate the new path, and the old replicated folder path in the database will no longer be tracked as a replicated folder.
error.action: This event is expected if the local path of the replicated folder has been changed. If this is not the case, for more information about troubleshooting this problem, see .

error.code: Overlapping replicated folders ( and ) were detected.
error.description: The DFS Replication service cannot replicate the replicated folder at local path because it overlaps with the replicated folder at local path .
error.action: Fix this problem by not overlapping these replicated folders i.e. point each folder to a unique local path.

error.code: Replicated folder is overlapping with Windows system folder.
error.description: The DFS Replication service failed to initialize replicated folder because it detected that one of its working folders () overlaps with a Windows system folder. Replication is not taking place because this is an unsupported configuration.
error.action: Reconfigure the replicated folder so that none of its working folders overlaps a Windows system folder.

error.code: Replicated folder is overlapping with debug log folder.
error.description: The DFS Replication service failed to initialize replicated folder because the service detected that one of its working folders overlaps with the debug log folder . Replication is not taking place because this is an unsupported configuration.
error.action: Reconfigure the replicated folder so that none of its working folders overlaps with the debug log folder.

error.code: Inconsistent volume configuration on .
error.description: The DFS Replication service detected and discarded inconsistent volume configuration on volume with error ID: (). Additional inforamtion: Inconsistent object ID and inconsistent object Type .
error.action: For information about troubleshooting this problem, see .

error.code: Machine configuration file for DFS Replication service has been created with default settings.
error.description: The DFS Replication service did not find a valid machine configuration file at the location specified. It has created a new machine configuration file with default settings. If you made custom changes to the configuration file, such as setting a static RPC port for replication, these changes have been lost. You must recreate these changes.
error.action: Use the command-line tool Dfsrdiag.exe to recreate the custom changes in the machine configuration file file.

error.code: No connections are enabled for .
error.description: The DFS Replication service has detected that there are no connections enabled for replication group . No data for this replication group is replicating to or from this server.
error.action: To resume replication, enable connections using the DFS Management snap-in or the Dfsradmin.exe command-line tool.

error.code: No connections exist for .
error.description: The DFS Replication service has detected that there are no connections configured for replication group . No data for this replication group is being replicated to or from this server.
error.action: To resume replication, create connections using the DFS Management snap-in or the Dfsradmin.exe command-line tool.

error.code: Failed to create or update the failover cluster resource.
error.action: Confirm that the volumes that host the replicated folder and its staging path are online. When the required volumes are online, the service will automatically create the failover cluster resource.

error.code: Failed to delete the failover cluster resource; no action required.
Failed to update failover cluster resource properties; no action required.
Failed to bring the failover cluster resource online; no action required.
The local path of a replicated folder on a failover cluster is not valid.
error.action: Using the DFS Management MMC snap-in, delete the replicated folder from the member in the replication group . Add the replicated folder back to this replication group with a local path that is on a volume that belongs to a cluster shared disk.

error.code: The local path of a replicated folder is not valid.
error.action: Using the DFS Management MMC snap-in, delete the replicated folder from the local computer in the replication group . Add the replicated folder back to the replication group with a local path that is not on a cluster shared disk.

error.code: The local path of the staging folder on a failover cluster is not valid.
error.action: Using the DFS Management MMC snap-in, change the staging folder for the replicated folder on the member in the replication group . The new staging folder must be located on a volume that belongs to a cluster shared disk.

error.code: The local path of the staging folder is not valid.
error.action: Using the DFS Management MMC snap-in, change the staging folder for the replicated folder on this local computer in the replication group . The new staging folder must not be located on a volume that belongs to a cluster shared disk.

error.code: The local path of a replicated folder is not valid.
error.action: Using the DFS Management MMC snap-in, delete the replicated folder from the member in the replication group . Add the replicated folder back to this replication group so that the network name resource for the member and the volume that hosts the replicated folder are in the same cluster group.

error.code: The local path of the staging folder is not valid.
error.action: Using the DFS Management MMC snap-in, change the path of the staging folder for the replicated folder on the member in the replication group . The volume that hosts the new staging folder and the network name resource must belong to the same cluster group.

error.code: A failover cluster and a node in the cluster cannot belong to the same replication group.
Two clustered file server instances on the same failover cluster cannot belong to the same replication group.
The local path for the SYSVOL replicated folder cannot be on a shared disk.
error.action: Demote and re-promote this domain controller using a SYSVOL local path on a volume that belongs to a non-shared disk.

error.code: The staging folder for the SYSVOL replicated folder cannot be on a shared disk.
error.action: Using the DFS Management MMC snap-in, change the path of the staging folder for the SYSVOL folder on this domain controller. The new staging folder must be located on a volume that belongs to a non-shared disk.

error.code: The staging folder or local path of a replicated folder cannot be verified.
error.action: Using the Failover cluster Management UI, online the disk hosting the replicated folder from the member in the replication group . Once the disk is online and available then DFSR will be able to verify the paths and start replicating.

error.code: Cannot access the local WMI repository.
error.description: Due to an Access Denied error, the DFS Replication reporting mechanism cannot access the WMI (Windows Management Instrumentation) namespace to retrieve certain reporting information.
error.action: Verify that you are a member of the local Administrators group on this server.

error.code: Cannot access the local WMI repository.
error.description: Due to the following error, the DFS Replication reporting mechanism cannot access the WMI (Windows Management Instrumentation) namespace to retrieve certain reporting information. Error ID: .
error.action: For information about troubleshooting WMI errors, see .

error.code: The DFS Replication service is not installed on .
error.description: The DFS Replication service is not installed on this server. No replicated folders are replicating to or from this server.
error.action:
Ensure that Windows Server 2003 R2 is installed on this server and that the DFS Replication service was installed using Add or Remove Programs. If Windows Server 2003 R2 is installed, you can use the following procedure to install the DFS Replication service:
In Add or Remove Programs, click Add/Remove Windows Components.
In the Windows Components Wizard, click Distributed File System, and then click Details.
Click DFS Replication service, click OK, and then complete the wizard.

error.code: The DFS Replication service is stopped.
error.description: The DFS Replication service is stopped. No replicated folders are replicating to or from this server.
error.action: Restart the DFS Replication service either by using the Services snap-in or by typing net start dfsr at the command prompt.

error.code: The DFS Replication service is disabled.
error.description: The DFS Replication service is disabled. No replicated folders are replicating to or from this server.
error.action:
In the Services snap-in, do the following:
Double-click DFS Replication service.
On the General tab, in Startup type, click Automatic.
To start the DFS Replication service, click Start.

error.code: Cannot access the local WMI repository.
error.description: The DFS Replication reporting mechanism cannot find the WMI (Windows Management Instrumentation) namespace to retrieve certain reporting information. Error ID: .
error.action: For information about troubleshooting WMI errors, see .

error.code: Cannot access the local WMI repository.
error.description: DFS Replication reporting mechanism cannot access the WMI (Windows Management Instrumentation) namespace to retrieve certain reporting information because of timeout. Error ID: .
error.action: For information about troubleshooting WMI errors, see .

error.code: Unable to access required data source.
error.description: The DFS Replication reporting mechanism cannot access a required data source. Error ID: .
error.action: Please verify proper access permissions. For information about troubleshooting backlog errors, see .

error.code: Cannot access DFS Replication performance counters.
error.description: The DFS Replication service is unable to access the performance counter on . Performance data is unavailable. Error ID: .
error.action: Please verify that the DFSR service is started, that the DFSR WMI provider is registered and the performance counters are available locally by loading them into PerfMon. If you suspect that the performance counters are corrupt, please refer to KB article 300956 .

error.code: Backlog counts are unavailable due to failure.
error.description: A failure occurred while the reporting mechanism processed version vectors on the reference member. Version vectors are used to compare how up-to-date this server is compared to the reference server. If version vectors cannot be processed, then the backlog, if any, cannot be determined
error.action: For information about troubleshooting backlog errors, see .

error.code: This member is waiting for initial replication for replicated folder .
error.description: This member is waiting for initial replication for replicated folder and is not currently participating in replication. This delay can occur because the member is waiting for the DFS Replication service to retrieve replication settings from Active Directory Domain Services. After the member detects that it is part of replication group, the member will begin initial replication.
error.action: Replication will begin after initial replication is complete. If this state does not change, see .

error.code: Volume is low on disk space.
error.description: Volume is low on disk space. If this volume becomes full, the DFS Replication service will stop replication on the volume.
error.action: Increase available disk space on the specified volume or move the replicated folder to a different volume. See additional information about disk space under the informational section in the table titled "Current used and free disk space on volumes where replicated folders are stored.

error.code: The RPC hotfix is not installed on this server.
error.description: This hotfix addresses RPC issues that can cause the DFS Replication service to fail, possibly without corresponding failure events in the DFS Replication event log. If the DFS Replication service does not restart automatically, replication backlogs can occur that are not easily attributed to RPC issues. Therefore, we highly recommend that you install this hotfix on all servers participating in DFS Replication.
error.action: To learn more about this fix and how to obtain it, see .

error.code: Pre-existing content is not replicated and is consuming disk space.
error.description: During the initial replication process for replicated folder , the DFS Replication service identified pre-existing local content that was not present on the primary member and moved the content to . The DfsrPrivate\Preexisting folder is a hidden system folder that is located under the local path of the replicated folder. Content in the DfsrPrivate\PreExisting folder will not be replicated to other members of the replication group, nor will the content be deleted by the DFS Replication service during any automatic clean-up.
error.action: If you want this content to be replicated to other members, move the content into the replicated folder outside of the DfsrPrivate folder. If you want to reclaim this disk space, delete the pre-existing content in the PreExisting folder.

error.code: One or more replicated folders have content skipped by DFS Replication.
error.description: DFS Replication does not replicate certain files in the replicated folders listed above because they have temporary attribute set, or they are symbolic links . This problem is affecting at least files in replicated folders (up to 100 occurences per replicated folder are reported).
error.action: Verify that the files you want to replicate are not temporary and not symbolic links.

error.code: Cannot retrieve version vectors from this member.
error.description: Backlog calculations cannot be performed because an error occurred while the reporting mechanism attempted to retrieve version vectors from this member: . Version vectors are used to compare how up-to-date this server is compared to the reference server. If version vectors cannot be processed, then the backlog, if any, cannot be determined.
error.action: For information about troubleshooting backlog problems, see .

error.code: Cannot retrieve inbound version vectors from this member.
error.description: Inbound backlog calculations cannot be performed because the following error occurred while the reporting mechanism attempted to retrieve version vectors from this member: Version vectors are used to compare how up-to-date this server is compared to the reference server. If version vectors cannot be processed, then the backlog, if any, cannot be determined.
error.action: For information about troubleshooting backlog problems, see .

error.code: Reference member returned no replicated folders.
error.description: Backlog calculations cannot be performed because the reference member returned zero replicated folders.
error.action: For information about troubleshooting backlog problems, see .

error.code: Cannot retrieve version vectors from this member due to a Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) error.
error.description: Backlog calculations cannot be performed because DFS Replication encountered the following error while accessing the Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) repository to retrieve version vectors from this member: , see to resolve the error string.
error.action: For information about troubleshooting WMI access issues, .

error.code: Cannot get inbound backlogs from this member due to a Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) error.
error.description: Inbound backlog counts cannot be determined because DFS Replication encountered the following error while accessing the Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) to retrieve backlog counts from this member: .

error.code: Cannot connect to reporting DCOM server.
error.action: Verify that the DFS Replication Service is installed on the server and that RPC traffic is not blocked by firewalls or port filtering. For information about troubleshooting RPC issues see .

error.code: Cannot retrieve report.
